required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Weight, Body Composition and Cardiac Risk After Discontinuing Abacavir Treatment in HIV-infected Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Weight and Body Composition After Switch to Dolutegravir/Lamivudine Compared to Continued Dolutegravir/Abacavir/Lamivudine for Virologically Suppressed HIV Infection: A Randomized Open-label Superiority Trial: AVERTAS-1

brief_summary.textblock:
Randomized controlled parallel open-label study in people living with HIV and at least 6 month of treatment with dolutegravir/abacavir/lamivudine prior to inclusion.
Participants (n=95) are randomized to continue 3 drug-regimen dolutegravir/abacavir/lamivudine (control) or switch to two-drug regimen with dolutegravir/lamivudine (intervention). Follow-up is 48 weeks. Data is collected at baseline and week 48. Primary outcome is changes in weight from baseline of more than 2 kg. Secondary outcomes are changes in cardiac risk, composition and calcification of the heart tissue, and changes in body composition and metabolism, inflammation and coagulation. A MRI substudy is applied to focus on the cardiac adverse effects of abacavir.

detailed_description.textblock: In the MRI sub study 40 patients from the main study (20 from each group) are included. A cardiac MRI are performed at baseline and week 48 to evaluate cardiac effects of abacavir.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A randomized controlled open-label superiority trial

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in body weight of ≥2 kg

secondary_outcome.description: 12-item Short Form Health Survey (SF-12). Scores from 0 (worse) to 100 (best).
Impaired insulin resistance and/or β-cell function determined by changes in Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
D:A:D CVD risk score: Five and ten years predicted cardio vascular disease risk (percent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in carotid artery intima-media thickness (cIMT)
Changes in Coronary artery calcium score (CACS)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures by CT-scan. Scores from 0 and with no upper limit. The higher score, the worse calcification/plaque level and higher CVD risk.
Changes in N-terminal pro-B-type natriuretic peptide (Pro-BNP)
Measured by CT-scan • Visceral adipose tissue (VAT) and subcutaneous adipose tissue (SAT) determined by abdominal CT.
Measured by CT-scan and liver elastography
Measured by CT-scan and liver elastography

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in fat distribution in trunk, limb and extremities
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by dual energy xray absorptiometry (DEXA)
Vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 and intercellular adhesion molecule 1
Framingham risk score: Estimated 10 years risk of cardiovascular disease (percent)

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy primary outcome (composite) ECV
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Decrease in extracellular myocardial volume (ECV) from baseline to week 48

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy primary outcome (composite) atrial volume
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Decrease in left atrial volume from baseline to week 48

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy primary outcome (composite) diastolic function
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Improvement in diastolic function from baseline to week 48

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy primary outcome (composite) myocardial mass
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Reduction in myocardial mass from baseline to week 48

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy secondary outcome ejection fraction (EF)
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Secondary outcomes Changes in: • Ejection fraction (EF)

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy secondary outcome perfusion
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Secondary outcomes Changes in: • Perfusion

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy secondary outcome edema/inflammation
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Secondary outcomes Changes in: • Edema/inflammation

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy secondary outcome fibrosis
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Secondary outcomes Changes in: • Fibrosis

other_outcome.measure: Cardiac MRI substudy secondary outcome lipid
other_outcome.description: Cardiac MRI applied on 40 patients to evaluate: Secondary outcomes Changes in: • Lipid-water profile Measured by MR spectroscopy

arm_group.description: 50 mg dolutegravir and 300 mg lamivudine (co-formulated) once daily for 48 weeks
50 mg dolutegravir, 600 mg abacavir and 300 mg lamivudine (co-formulated) once daily for 48 weeks

intervention.description: Discontinuing abacavir by switching from three-drug regimen with dolutegravir/abacavir/lamivudine to two-drug regimen with dolutegravir/lamivudine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 18 years old
- Diagnosed HIV
- At least 6 months of ongoing treatment with dolutegravir/ abacavir/lamivudine
- Plasma viral load (HIV-RNA) < 50 copies/ml at inclusion
For women of childbearing potential:
- Negative pregnancy test
- Willingness to use contraceptive (consistent with local regulations) during study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing viral resistance mutations to lamivudine or to dolutegravir
- Presence of hepatitis B antigen (HBsAg) or Hepatitis B virus DNA (HBV DNA)
- Cancer within past 5 years
- Diabetes, cardiovascular disease or other chronic illness considered stable as assessed by the treating physician
For women of childbearing potential:
- Pregnancy
- Breastfeeding

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Infectious diseases, Hvidovre Hospital, Denmark
